lead_paragraph: "Treme," the new HBO series from David Simon, about New Orleans in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, doesn't begin until next Sunday, but you don't have to wait until then to see a work that explores disaster in the modern American city. Tonight, The Kitchen presents the world premiere of "Bellona, Destroyer of Cities." The interdisciplinary theater work is adapted and directed by Jay Scheib from Samuel R. Delany's science fiction novel "Dhalgren," and is set in a city after a cataclysmic event. It is the second part in Mr. Scheib's trilogy, "Simulated Cities/Simulated Systems," and features passages from the novel with original material, movement and live video. Performances begin at 8 p.m.
